Diabetic Granola Recipe

If you're a diabetic or trying to manage your blood sugar levels, finding healthy and delicious snacks can be a challenge. Granola is a popular choice for many, but store-bought options are often loaded with added sugars and unhealthy fats. Luckily, there's a solution – a homemade diabetic granola recipe that is both tasty and blood sugar-friendly.

To make this diabetic granola, you'll need a few simple ingredients. Start with rolled oats, which are a great source of fiber and help regulate blood sugar levels. Add in a variety of nuts and seeds like almonds, walnuts, and flaxseeds for added crunch and healthy fats. These ingredients are packed with nutrients and won't cause a spike in blood sugar.

To sweeten the granola, use a natural sugar substitute like stevia or monk fruit. These alternatives provide sweetness without the negative effects on blood sugar levels. You can also add a touch of cinnamon or vanilla extract for extra flavor.

Mix all the ingredients together in a bowl, then spread the mixture onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake at a low temperature, around 300°F, for about 30 minutes or until the granola is golden brown and crispy. Be sure to stir the mixture occasionally to ensure even baking.

Once the granola is cooled, you can store it in an airtight container for up to two weeks. Enjoy it as a snack on its own, or sprinkle it over yogurt or cottage cheese for a satisfying and blood sugar-friendly breakfast.

This homemade diabetic granola recipe is a great alternative to store-bought options that are often loaded with added sugars. It's easy to make, customizable to your taste preferences, and will help you maintain stable blood sugar levels. Give it a try and enjoy a delicious and guilt-free snack!
